## Python Data Explorer

This is a minimal example of Shinylive in Quarto.

It may take some seconds to load.

```{shinylive-python}
#| standalone: true
#| viewerHeight: 500

from shiny import App, render, ui
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

app_ui = ui.page_fluid(
    ui.h2("Simple Data Generator"),
    ui.input_slider("n", "Number of points:", 10, 100, 50),
    ui.input_selectize("dist", "Distribution:", 
                      {"normal": "Normal", "uniform": "Uniform"}),
    ui.output_plot("plot"),
    ui.output_text("stats")
)

def server(input, output, session):
    
    @output
    @render.plot
    def plot():
        n = input.n()
        if input.dist() == "normal":
            data = np.random.normal(0, 1, n)
        else:
            data = np.random.uniform(-2, 2, n)
            
        plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
        plt.hist(data, bins=15, alpha=0.7)
        plt.title(f"{input.dist().title()} Distribution (n={n})")
        return plt.gcf()
    
    @output
    @render.text
    def stats():
        n = input.n()
        if input.dist() == "normal":
            data = np.random.normal(0, 1, n)
        else:
            data = np.random.uniform(-2, 2, n)
        return f"Mean: {np.mean(data):.2f}, Std: {np.std(data):.2f}"

app = App(app_ui, server)
```

That's it! A working interactive Python dashboard.
